title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 326-1.7 - Conduct of hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 326-1.7 - Conduct of hearing

State Regulations

The county medical society, or the workers' compensation
committee of a county medical society, in the conduct of a hearing shall not be
bound by common law or statutory rules of evidence, or by technical or formal
rules of procedure, except as provided herein; and may make such investigation
or inquiry and conduct such hearing in the manner it deems advisable and
necessary. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
326-1.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
